snippet: The unauthenticated recordings are the latest that appear to capture the private meetings and phone calls of senior defense officials. All have been released through Islamist news outlets that oppose President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.
abstract: Unauthenticated audio recordings of senior Egyptian officials seem to show both Egyptian military and United Arab Emirates played much greater part in stoking protests against Pres Mohamed Morsi in June 2013 than has been admitted; recordings are released through Islamic news outlets that oppose Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

byline.contributor: Merna Thomas contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The unauthenticated recordings are the latest that appear to capture the private meetings and phone calls of senior defense officials. All have been released through Islamist news outlets that oppose President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi.

headline.main: Recordings Suggest Emirates and Egyptian Military Pushed Ousting of Morsi
headline.print_headline: Recordings Suggest Emirates and Egyptian Military Pushed Ousting of Morsi
